title: MPC Kinetic launches IPO, seeks $230 million
text:
Oil and gas sector services business MPC Kinetic is seeking to raise $228.5 million at $2.50 a share for its initial public offering.

It is understood brokers Credit Suisse and UBS have been quietly securing support for the float in recent weeks, locking in a handful of institutions.

ASX-aspirant MPC Kinetic has delivered a 4,100km CSG gathering network for QGC. Peter Braig

The deal is expected to launch on Wednesday at a fixed price of $2.50 a share. It is understood the early indications of interest account for about one-third of the book size. The roadshow meetings kick off in Sydney before moving to Melbourne and then offshore next week.

The deal implies about a $450 million market capitalisation and is priced at 6.6-times forecast EBITDA.

The brokers have scheduled a bookbuild for October 10 to sell the shares.

Funds were told MPC Kinetic expects $64 million EBITDA in the 2020 financial year, up from $59 million in 2019.
description: Oil and gas sector services business MPC Kinetic is seeking to raise $228.5 million at $2.50 a share for its initial public offering.
